fullProgramDescription: The Mathematics - Secondary Education major is designed for students who wish to teach secondary mathematics. The program provides a comprehensive education in mathematics and prepares students for a teaching career. Students learn about mathematical concepts, problem-solving, and communication. The major includes coursework in mathematics, education, and preparation for the California teaching credential.
shortProgramDescription: The Mathematics - Secondary Education B.A. prepares students to teach secondary mathematics, providing a comprehensive education in mathematics and teaching methods.
classHighlights: The major requires a series of mathematics core courses, including calculus (MATH20A-B-C-D), linear algebra (MATH20F), and differential equations (MATH20D or MATH140A-B).
Students take additional mathematics courses, such as abstract algebra (MATH100 or MATH103A-B), real analysis (MATH104A-B-C or MATH105A-B), and geometry (MATH102 or MATH107A-B).
Students also complete education coursework, including introduction to secondary education (MAE301A-B), teaching methods (MAE303A-B), and student teaching (MAE401).
The major includes preparation for the California Single Subject Teaching Credential in Mathematics, with courses covering teaching methods, classroom management, and educational psychology.
learningOutcomes: Demonstrate a deep understanding of mathematical concepts and principles.
Communicate mathematical ideas effectively to students.
Apply teaching methods and strategies to engage students in learning mathematics.
Understand the principles of learning and teaching mathematics in a secondary education setting.
Prepare for the California Single Subject Teaching Credential in Mathematics.
additionalInformation: Students must apply for the Mathematics - Secondary Education major and complete the required coursework. Preparation for the California Single Subject Teaching Credential in Mathematics is included in the major.
